title: José Fernández (third baseman)
text:
José Mayobanex Fernández Rojas (born November 2, 1974) is a retired <a href="third%20baseman">third baseman</a> in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a>, the <a href="KBO%20League">KBO League</a>, <a href="Nippon%20Professional%20Baseball">Nippon Professional Baseball</a> (NPB), and the <a href="Dominican%20Winter%20Baseball%20League">Dominican Winter Baseball League</a>. He played eleven years in the NPB, compiling a .282 batting average with 206 home runs and 772 runs batted in.
Fernández played briefly in Major League Baseball for the <a href="Montreal%20Expos">Montreal Expos</a> () and the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Angels">Anaheim Angels</a> (). He just <a href="Batting%20average%20%28baseball%29">hit</a> .143 in 49 <a href="at-bat">at-bat</a>s during his MLB career.
After a successful season in Korea in 2002 with the <a href="SSG%20Landers">SK Wyverns</a>, in 2003 Fernández came to Japan to play Nippon Professional Baseball. He played one season for the <a href="Chiba%20Lotte%20Marines">Chiba Lotte Marines</a> in 2003, and then two seasons for the <a href="Saitama%20Seibu%20Lions">Seibu Lions</a> in 2004–2005. Fernández was a key member of the <a href="2004%20Japan%20Series">2004 Japan Series</a>-champion Lions team. 
Moving to the <a href="Tohoku%20Rakuten%20Golden%20Eagles">Tohoku Rakuten Golden Eagles</a>, he played for that team for three seasons, in 2006–2008. While playing for the Golden Eagles, he was a <a href="Pacific%20League">Pacific League</a> <a href="Best%20Nine%20Award">Best Nine Award</a>-winner at third base in 2006. On April 1, 2007, Fernández and <a href="Takeshi%20Yamasaki">Takeshi Yamasaki</a> hit <a href="Grand%20slam%20%28baseball%29">grand slams</a> in the same inning for the Golden Eagles. Fernández led the Golden Eagles in RBI in 2008, with 99.
Fernández played for the champion <a href="Dominican%20Republic%20national%20baseball%20team">Dominican Republic national baseball team</a> in the <a href="2007%20Caribbean%20Series">2007 Caribbean Series</a>.
Fernández played for the <a href="Orix%20Buffaloes">Orix Buffaloes</a> in 2009 and then returned to the Saitama Seibu Lions franchise for 2010–2011. He returned to the Golden Eagles in 2012, and then returned to the Buffaloes for his final season, 2013.
After briefly playing in <a href="Mexican%20League%20%28baseball%29">Mexican League</a> for the <a href="Tigres%20de%20Quintana%20Roo">Tigres de Quintana Roo</a> in 2010, Fernández was signed by the <a href="Seibu%20Lions">Seibu Lions</a> on a ¥30million deal to the end of the season.
